intro: Licania parvifructa, commonly known as the small-fruited licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, elliptical leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, typical of the family. Licania parvifructa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swamps.
